A Complete Guide To

Top Universities in France

Chapter 1

Overview

France is one of the most sought after destinations to study abroad. It offers a multicultural experience for international students. You can even travel to multiple countries in Europe while you study there. Many of the world’s best universities are located in France. Around 250,000 international students study in France every single year. You don’t only learn about the course you’ve picked but also the French language and culture from the natives. France has serene and beautiful surroundings, and many famous scientists are alumni from some of the Universities in France! Some universities offer courses through various established faculties and there are specific schools dedicated to certain courses such as business.

There are a huge variety of courses in France that you might like. Want to know more? Keep reading!

Why study in France?

Salut! Do you want to study in France or are you skeptical about it? Well, I’m here to give you a ton of reasons why pursuing your education in France is extremely useful for your career and exciting with new experiences, especially if you are an international student.

Multicultural Experience

One of the reasons you may have chosen to come to France from your home country. Because students from multicultural regions come in to study in France as well. A statistic states that over 29% of the student population in France accounts for international students. You not only get the cultural experience of France but also the cultures of other students who belong to other countries.

Travel

France is a country in Europe. It allows you not only to travel and experience the cultures of France but also to other European countries. Countries such as Luxembourg, Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Spain, and Belgium are closer to France! If you’re someone who loves to travel, studying in France is one of the best travel opportunities you can get.

Food

French cuisine is Iconic! They have colourful food and beautiful restaurants. France is known for exquisite delicacies such as the crunchiest baguettes, rich and flavorful sauces, amazing pastries and Bouillabaisse. If you’re someone who enjoys French cuisine Studying in France is an added advantage.

Fashion

Since the fifteenth century, France has been known for its contribution to fashion. The city of Paris, which is the capital of France is also known as the “global fashion capital”. The Paris fashion week takes place twice a year and is one of the most popular fashion shows. If you love fashion this country is a great place

Art

If you are a student of Fine Arts, France can be one of the best places to study art. For centuries, France has been known globally for its art , from paintings, sculptures, museums and films. It is also known for its extraordinary medieval architecture.

Academic Reasons to study in France

Best universities

Some of the world’s best universities are located in France. There are many different courses, which cater for the needs and interests of various students. From bachelor’s to research and double degree courses are available.

Scholarships

There are reasonable tuition rates with good scholarships for international students. There are many public universities especially located in Paris.

Opportunities

Excellent opportunities for students who want to pursue research. Talent and opportunity and innovation are valued here

City of students

As a country, France is known for its excellent lifestyle. It is also known for the city of Paris, which is one of the best cities in the world for students, due to the city being a host to some of the world’s best universities.

Why Choose Galvanize Admission Counselling?

Chapter 2

Eligibility and Requirements

Now that you know the top five reasons why you should go to France apart from academics, let’s hop onto the Eligibility and other requirements that you need to be a student in France.

For students who want to pursue an undergraduate degree

A completion certificate of any diploma courses or a high school graduation certificate. An entrance exam conducted by the universities in France has to be cleared

A personal interview round might also take place if a student wants to pursue a degree in the technology institutions

A certain level of French language exams has to be completed by the student to study in France

Language Requirements:

IELTS or TOEFL scores are required

Some universities and schools require the students to have completed a B2 or a DELF course in French.

For students who want to pursue a postgraduate degree

Competition of any diploma or an undergraduate certificate is necessary

Some universities want the student to complete tests such as GRE, GMAT

There will be an entrance exam for many universities

Top Universities in France

The following are a list of the top Universities in France.

Paris Sciences et Lettres University:

This university is situated in Paris, France. It was established as a University in the year 2019 and was founded on 2010

About:

This university is located in the beautiful city of Paris with over 17,000 students and 2,900 academic faculty. It is called a collegiate University which comprises 11 schools together. It Is a Public Research University. Their education is more focused on research with interdisciplinary learning. They teach courses in French and English. Hence. you must see in which language your course is taught.

Rankings

The world rank for this university is 36

Courses offered

UG: They offer Bachelor degrees in the field of management, economics and finance, accounting, applied mathematics, computing and Journalism

PG: They offer about 49 courses for Post Graduate Programme such as accounting, Acting and directing, Asian studies, Chemistry, Computer Science and so much more.

Website: https://psl.eu/en

FAQ:

Does Paris Sciences et Lettres University teach in English?

Yes they do teach in English and French. There are multi disciplinary courses for bachelors, masters, PhD and executive education.

Is Paris Sciences et Lettres Université a private university?

No, it is a public research university in Paris, France.

What is Paris Sciences et Lettres University known for?

It is known for its research, innovations and ideas. This university is important in the European academy.

Ecole Polytechnique

This university is located in Palaiseau, Paris, France. It was founded on the 11th of March 1794.

About

This is considered the most prestigious university in France. It is a French Public Institution. Many scientists such as Schwartz z, Fresnel and Polincaré are alumni of this institution. This institution was founded by a mathematician called Gaspard Monge. It has over 3,370 students. It was found during the period of the French Revolution. This institution is currently run by the French Ministry of Defence. The students belonging to France must go through a military service offered by this institute. An exception is made for the International students.

Rankings

The world rank for this university is 61

The national rank is 2

Courses offered

They offer Bachelor’s degrees, Masters degrees and Doctoral programmes

UG: They offer a double Bachelor degree in the field of maths-physics, maths-economics etc

PG: A range of courses from Chemistry to Nuclear Energy. Only science-based courses.

Sorbonne Université

This university is located in Paris, France. It was founded by Robert de Sorbon in the year 1150.

About

It is a Public University in Paris and it is one of the important universities there. Scientists such as Marie Curie, Pierre Curie, and renowned mathematician Henri Poincaré are some of the notable alumni of this university. Initially, it was a cooperative University. In Europe, it is the second oldest University. During the French Revolution of 1793, this university was closed and then reopened. Pope Innocent,completed his education here. The four main faculties in this university are Arts, Medicine, Law and Theology. This university is the headquarters for the European Marine Biological Research Centre.
